title: Why is dyrus still in TSM
body: all he does is feed like i don't remember when was the last time he won his lane and they switch out their jungler and support ever couple of months

replies.body: It's no really his fault that teams have found out that you can dive him for early kills and TSM won't respond. Top laners in this LCS meta have been feast or famine recently.
he is the team mascot, he, literally, IS tsm.
Although I do agree on the idea about Dyrus... in the end it doesn't matter.. TSM is going down that is for sure.

Dyrus is also the most camped top laner in American LCS. I honestly don't understand why Dyrus stays with TSM, they've made it clear they give no fucks about him and he's usually left out to dry in most games by Bjergson and Santorin. I will digress, its been slightly better recently. 

This is further exacerbated by teams knowing this which is why they gank him so aggressively, especially in early game, since they know there won't be any retaliation from them unless Santorin happens to be around for a free kill.

This is why they did so poorly in MSI, TSM tries to play a control game while not giving a shit about Dyrus against Korean teams, whom are notorious for aggressive game play, that was just a recipe for disaster. 

Gank Dyrus repeatedly, even when he's under the tower, get someone fed off those kills and its GG from there.

Dyrus is not the issue, TSM is making poor calls, and cant team fight like they use to.

I would like to see Dyrus pick Vlad, Singed, Fizz, Jayce, or Trundle once this split.

Tsm always has him on Gnar, Hecarim, or Lulu..........

Agreed, I'm sick of him picking the same champs every game, He plays a lot of {{champion:57}} to and I don't think {{champion:150}} is his best champ. He should pick someone more mobile with higher damage like the champs you mentioned His {{champion:8}} {{champion:27}} and {{champion:126}} have all been proven to be pretty good.
